head.supplied: Melbourne bot. & zoolog. Garden, ¶ 22 September 1859. ¶ Sir ¶ ¶ I have the honor to solicit, that you will be pleased to permit the sum of £150 to be transferred from the vote of "forage and food for...

div.p: M59/9917, unit 747, VPRS 1189 inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.
MS written by Carl Wilhelmi and signed by M. Melbourne bot. & zoolog. Garden,

I have the honor to solicit, that you will be pleased to permit the sum of £150 to be transferred from the vote of "forage and food for animals" to that of stores timber and tools of this establishment.

Altho' I would be able to carry with the remainder of the vote left for this purpose the most necessary work out during the rest of the year, I still solicit this additional grant for many important improvements on our ground, whilst an ample supply of forage is already provided for and thus the balance of that vote not needed.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: I have the honor to be

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p:
The Honorable the Chief Secretary.
On 29 September 1859 the Under Secretary, J. Moore, ordered that the transfer be scheduled.
